Philosophy
The package &homalg; is meant to be the first volume of a continuously growing opensource book about
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homological_algebra. &homalg; is an attempt to translate as much as possible of homological algebra, as can be found in books like , , , , and , into a language that also a computer can directly understand. And like these books, &homalg; should, to a great extent, be readable by a mathematician, even without programming knowledge. For the reasons mentioned below (&see; ) I have chosen &GAP4; as the language of this project.

Why &GAP4;
&GAP4; is an object oriented programming language that suits the needs of mathematical programming more than any other language designed by computer scientists. This was primarily achieved by the advanced
http://www.gap-system.org/Manuals/doc/htm/prg/CHAP002.htm techniques that very much resembles the mathematical way of thinking.
&GAP4; was developed by mathematicians who needed to handle complex mathematical structures carrying properties and attributes.
